About this role
Technology & Operations
Technology & Operations is the backbone for both the client lifecycle and the investment lifecycle. The group’s Follow the Sun Model ensures that the firm’s operations are consistent and efficient across all investment products, client channels and regions, helping to deliver a superior client experience and drive scalability. Technology & Operations is driven by a global network of Operating Centers of Excellence, which centralizes knowledge and equips support teams with the data and timely information needed to innovate and deliver on behalf of internal partners and clients.
BlackRock’s Technology & Enterprise Service Group aims to provide BlackRock Employees with robust technology infrastructure and strategic workplace solutions to deliver a consistent employee experience around the world, while handling information security and data integrity. Description
About this role
At BlackRock, we are looking for Software Engineers who like to innovate and solve sophisticated problems. We know that strength comes from diversity, and will embrace your unique skills and perspectives while giving you the opportunity to grow technically and as an individual.

With over USD $9 trillion of assets we have a fiduciary responsibility: our technology empowers millions of investors to save for retirement, pay for college, buy a home and improve their financial wellbeing. Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
POSITION TITLE
Trading Operations Analyst
LOCATION
Stamford, CT (hybrid)
This position is available to Connecticut, New Jersey and New York residents as Stamford, CT in-office applicants with a hybrid work schedule.
At Genworth, we are committed to caring for our customers and for the safety of our colleagues. In the event the office is inaccessible (e.g., inclement weather), this role may be required to work remotely.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.
The Asset Allocation Team within Advice & Guidance (A&G) is seeking a talented and quantitatively-oriented Associate Analyst to help build structured research models and infrastructure to inform decision making across a broad spectrum of asset classes. The role will support the development and help shape the firm's strategic and opportunistic asset allocation processes as well as the firm's capital market assumptions. This position is a part of the firm's Client Strategies Group Division.

The Wealth Management Advice and Solutions Division helps ensure that branch teams and our clients have a consistent supply of high-quality retirement, banking, insurance, mutual fund, and education savings products aligned with the firm's investment philosophy and solutions-based advice and guidance. In addition, the group drives innovation that will enhance products, services, processes and systems to meet our current and future client needs. These areas play a pivotal role in supporting the firm's goals of deeply serving clients and associates serve as the firm's subject matter experts for their respective areas.



Salary: $76798 - $130764
Category: Headquarters

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
The Research Analyst is a critical contributor to the companyâ€™s internally managed investment portfolios. Through thoughtful and comprehensive research and analysis, this position seeks to generate value-adding recommendations for the Investment Grade and High Yield fixed income portfolios.
Analyze investment opportunities and make recommendations on fixed income securities, including Investment Grade and High Yield corporates, US government securities and various securitized products.
Provide fundamental research and analysis on IG and HY corporate issuers, including financial modeling, indenture/covenant analysis, security analysis and management conference calls.
Collaborate with Portfolio Managers to develop relative value insight in your assigned sectors and issuers, focusing on generating outperformance through superior security selection.
" "

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
SEI as one of the leaders in Investment Management is looking for a trusted, driven, and analytical individual to grow our Fixed Income team. We are seeking an Analyst who has a genuine interest and passion for investments. This is an opportunity for an individual to gain a deeper understanding of manager selection, manager monitoring, portfolio construction performance and adherence to guidelines by assisting with the achievement of fund performance and risk objectives for assigned funds.

What you’ll do:
Portfolio Management

To assist in:
Portfolio design – eg, definition of investment opportunity set (ie alpha sources/investment strategies and securities to be eligible for investment); alpha and risk targets, investment parameters
Production of Fund Thesis and any other materials required for assigned funds, seeking approvals where required
Determining appropriate combination of managers in order to meet investment objectives through the market cycle
Determining the appropriate sizing of positions
Undertaking research to identify key drivers of investment returns/relative performance
Identifying, measuring and assessing relevant metrics of key return drivers on a periodic basis.
Investment Research
Undertake research on alpha sources, investment markets, investment strategies and investment products
Aid with the completion of market and data request from the broader team
Identify potential new fund managers
Create appropriate manager universes for key mandates
Undertake all aspects of manager research process including data collation, portfolio analysis and manager meetings
Produce research documentation as required
Communicate opinions and recommendations to other team members
Communication and Reporting
To assist in communications with SEI business units, external clients/prospects, and others as required :
Production of presentation materials
Communicating high level positioning / performance / investment process
Detailed communication concerning the performance and positioning of assigned funds
Actively participate in continuous improvement of process efficiency


Bachelor’s degree and, ideally, a CFA or progress toward designation.
2 to 5 years’ experience working within the asset management or multi-manager industry.
Good working knowledge of investment strategies and capital markets.
The ability to pick up in-depth knowledge of SEI products and services/technical financial information and effectively communicate that to relevant clients/audiences.
The ability to be credible in communications with peers and senior personnel.
Proficient IT skills - all Microsoft office products; ideally analytical tools such as Bloomberg, FactSet, BlackRock Aladdin, eVestment, Lipper. Ability to pick up other external and in-house systems/databases easily and to become resident expert in such systems.


Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Independent self-starter
Articulate and effective communicator
Constructive in team environment
Proactive in initiating and delivering projects, and curiosity to learn new methods


We are a technology and asset management company delivering on our promise of building brave futures SM —for our clients, our communities, and ourselves. Whether you’re in one of our global offices or remotely contributing your talent, our culture encourages collaboration, spurs creativity, and inspires the courage to unlock opportunities that help us realize our fullest potential.
Without people, it’s just work, so we take pride in caring for our employees and clients. We understand the importance of integrating work and life because finding harmony in your professional and personal activities is key to achieving fulfilment.
And inclusion isn’t just a buzz word for us—it’s at the core of our commitment to driving our collective success. We ask employees to bring their authentic selves to do their best work every day. It’s the power of diverse perspectives, experiences, and ideas that help us deliver the solutions that solve for our clients’ most complex challenges.
Six core values are the foundation of SEI’s culture. Care for our clients, communities, investors, and each other drives our commitment to these values.
We think and act like owners, embracing risk to drive growth for our clients and company.
We do what we say and act with transparency (because it’s the right thing to do).
We work with each other, our clients, partners, and communities to solve problems that matter.
We nurture an environment of respect and belonging where people are empowered to be themselves.
We build lasting relationships through which we learn, grow, and succeed.
We have Fun.
Does your brave future include professional growth, mastering new skills, and cultivating meaningful connections? Come build it with us, and join our community.

SEI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and so much more…
After 50years in business, SEI is a leading global provider of investment processing, investment management, and investment operations solutions. Reflecting our experience within financial services and financial technology our Oaks, PA office encompasses an open floor plan and numerous art installations designed to encourage innovation and creativity in our workforce. We recognize that our people are our most valuable asset and that a healthy, happy, and motivated workforce is key to our continued growth. At SEI, we’re (literally) invested in your success. We offer our employees paid parental leave, back-up childcare arrangements, paid volunteer days, education assistance and access to thriving employee networks.

SEI is an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
OUR AGENCY
Making a Difference
SWIB is a trusted and skilled global investment organization managing the assets of the Wisconsin Retirement System (WRS) and other separately managed funds. With over $165.6 billion in total assets under management, SWIB has been recognized by the investment industry for its teamwork and innovation that helps make it a premier asset manager. Sophisticated investment management strategies, forward-looking technologies, and strong internal asset management make SWIB a leading investment organization.
For public employees in Wisconsin, SWIB is a unique and valuable partner. Investing for the financial security of more than 652,000 individuals – and for the 1,500 Wisconsin employers who contribute on behalf of their employees – SWIB’s strong management of the WRS has helped fuel one of only a few fully funded public pension funds in the country. SWIB’s long-term investment returns meet the challenges of a constantly evolving investment landscape while helping grow and protect the assets of the WRS, which consistently ranks among the 10 largest public pension funds in the U.S.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Your Opportunity

Wealth and Asset Management Engineering (WAM) is part of the Schwab Technology Services (STS) organization which is responsible for the company’s use of information technology including all telecommunications, operations and client and business applications.
WAM Engineering Investments Technology is aligned to support the technology needs of Schwab Asset Management (SAM) investment professionals across portfolio management, trading, and compliance for Schwab’s proprietary mutual funds, referred to as the Schwab Funds and Schwab’s exchange-traded funds, referred to as the Schwab ETFs™. With over $500bn in assets under management, SAM is the 3rd largest provider of index funds, 5th largest provider of ETFs and the 7th largest provider of money market funds.
This team is essentially the front-office for Schwab Asset Management that continues to harness the state-of-the-art technologies for differentiating Schwab portfolio research and asset management. The team has won several industry awards such as the “Best IT Team of the Year” and the “Asset Manager Digital Tool of the Year”. Team is high performing and plays a key role in developing the business strategy, designing systems, maintaining vendor systems, and delivering to high quality standards.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
The Research Analyst is a critical contributor to the company’s internally managed investment portfolios. Through thoughtful and comprehensive research and analysis, this position seeks to generate value-adding recommendations for the Investment Grade and High Yield fixed income portfolios.
Analyze investment opportunities and make recommendations on fixed income securities, including Investment Grade and High Yield corporates, US government securities and various securitized products.
Provide fundamental research and analysis on IG and HY corporate issuers, including financial modeling, indenture/covenant analysis, security analysis and management conference calls.
Collaborate with Portfolio Managers to develop relative value insight in your assigned sectors and issuers, focusing on generating outperformance through superior security selection.
" "

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
As a Senior Investment Data Analyst you will play a key role in the establishment and continuous improvement of Venerable’s investment data environment. This includes ongoing investment data operations and development support for the maintenance of a centralized repository for asset-related data to act as a single source of the truth to serve a variety of stakeholders across the organization. The role will involve data integrity, data integration, data reconciliation, data governance, as well as investment and risk analytics reporting.
Ensure the integrity and completeness of investment data in the risk and analytics platform through the following:
Oversee and monitor data flows to ensure timely receipt of investment data and delivery of production reports from third party sources/vendors, and work closely with internal and external partners to address any issues that might arise.
Design and implement analysis tools to reconcile data obtained from multiple sources, and enable periodic/ad hoc data validations and tests of reasonability and consistency to ensure data accuracy and completeness.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Details
Description
The Quantitative Analyst is responsible for developing processes and integrating platforms to facilitate asset allocation, risk management, regulatory reporting, and performance measurement by implementing quantitative models and back testing quantitative strategies. This individual will focus on the top level asset allocation function while also participating in sector investment research and decisions. The Quantitative Analyst will work with other departments, as well as management, to develop a solid understanding of life insurance business and research methodology employed by asset classes in terms of security selection and risk management and be part of a highly collaborative team responsible for making investment decisions in a variety of public and private fixed income and derivatives sectors.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
All offices are currently open, and our employees are back 4 or 5 days a week in Hudson Yards, NY and 3 days a week in all other offices. If you have questions on this policy or the application process, please contact recruiting@gafg.com.
Company policy requires all employees and visitors to the Hudson Yards, NY office to be vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Global Atlantic Financial Group is a leader in the U.S. life insurance and annuity industry, serving the needs of individuals and institutions. Global Atlantic is a majority-owned subsidiary of KKR, a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management across multiple strategies and capital markets solutions.

Global Atlantic is looking for a diverse team of talented individuals who reinforce our culture of collaboration and innovation. We are dedicated to the career development of our people because we know they are critical to our long-term success. Join our team and come grow with us.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Position Overview

Under limited supervision and often under time pressure, design, implement, and maintain investment reporting initiatives to ensure timely, accurate, meaningful, and cost-effective analytics to regular and ad hoc reporting requests. Participate in a wide range of departmental projects and activities with an emphasis on analytics, reporting and communications. Serves as a resource to assist in complex issue resolution, enhancing current processes and procedures, and developing new processes to improve the effectiveness of the deliverables.

Responsibilities
Perform complex reporting functions in order to produce and maintain daily, month-end, quarter-end, semi-annual, and annual investment reports for the RGA Board of Directors, various Investment Committees, business units, and other legal entities as requested, including ad hoc reporting requests. Maintain supporting documentation and historical reports. Proof all reports before distribution and provide feedback to team members.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
OwnBackup is one of the fastest growing global SaaS companies. With nearly 5,000 customers, we are ranked on the Forbes Cloud 100 as one of the world's top private cloud companies and have raised over $500 million in funding from AIkeon Capital, B Capital Group, BlackRock Private Equity Partners, Insight Partners and others.
Co-founded by seasoned data-recovery, data-protection, and information-security experts, OwnBackup is a backup and restore independent software vendor (ISV) on the Salesforce AppExchange. Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Classification:
Our Business:
PGIM Fixed Income is a global asset manager offering active solutions across all fixed income markets. With over 950 employees and $790bn assets under management, the company has offices in Newark, London, Letterkenny, Amsterdam, Munich, Zurich, Tokyo, Hong Kong, and Singapore. Our business climate is a safe inclusive environment, centered around mutual respect, intellectual honesty, transparency and teamwork. Our leaders are focused on talent & culture; dedicated to fostering growth & development at all levels to develop the industry leaders of tomorrow.
PGIM believes in the Power of a Hybrid work arrangement. The Power of Hybrid is both the flexibility of work from home, as well as the networking and career development of in-person work with colleagues through weekly anchor day(s). This is a hybrid role with the Analyst coming into the Newark, NJ office three days per week.

Title: Trade Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Position Overview

Responsible for managing a segment of the structured products portfolio, including trade execution, to meet the investment guidelines of each investment portfolio while also considering liquidity needs, diversification, regulatory and capital considerations, and exploring ways to accommodate growth of the invested assets by identifying new investment opportunities within the structured product markets.
Continuously monitor markets and sector fundamentals, develop, and maintain relationships with brokers and take appropriate actions required to achieve the company’s goals, with a strong track record in credit performance, minimizing principal losses while achieving desired returns.

About Us:
SambaNova Systems is an AI innovation company that empowers organizations to deploy best-in-class solutions for computer vision, natural language processing, recommendation, and AI for science with confidence. SambaNova's flagship offering, Dataflow-as-a-Service™, helps organizations rapidly deploy AI in days, unlocking new revenue and boosting operational efficiency. SambaNova's DataScale® is an integrated software and hardware system using Reconfigurable Dataflow Architecture™ (RDA), along with open standards and user interfaces.
Description:
This is an opportunity for a manager of the Container/Kubernetes software engineer team that will lead the container and Kubernetes technologies for AI, ML, and scientific applications in high-performance distributed systems. This role will require the candidate to build and lead a new engineering team to participate in developing, testing, and deploying next-generation high-performance compute systems for AI applications at scale. You will have both a strong technical background in programming, architecting, and building software in distributed systems and good leadership and management skills.

This is a remote position.

Title: Associate, Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Description
About this role
Team Overview
This role is part of a global System Operations team focusing on using cloud capabilities within BlackRock’s powerful asset management platform. Members of our team have a proven track record of solving some of the firms most difficult problems in a scalable, resilient, and secure manner. We are passionate about solving difficult problems through technology and are focused on utilizing the cloud to seek large scale challenges.
This team will build the automation around provisioning, monitoring, and updating cloud infrastructure, as well as tooling to automate migrations to the cloud. The team will also be responsible for finding opportunities to improve our architecture using cloud and cloud-native technologies.

Title: Associate, Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Description
About this role
Alternative Investments Software Engineer (Java) – Associate
Working on the Alternatives Digital Strategy team provides an exciting opportunity to apply data and technology to scale one of BlackRock’s fastest growing investment platforms. As part of the BlackRock Alternative Investors (BAI) group, we design, implement, and develop the latest in private markets investing technology and data analytics.
Our objective is to offer BAI investment professionals the best technology and analytical solutions to help them better understand and manage their alternative investment portfolios. Clients are accelerating their allocation to alternative investments, yet private markets investment technology isn’t as mature as that of public markets, and data is more sparse. This creates an incredible opportunity for data and technology driven individuals to have an impact on our digital strategy. Having the Aladdin and eFront technology platforms available as the backbone to our work, our team has a wealth of resources and expertise to tap into. One aspect of that is implementing eFront for our BAI investment teams and working with our colleagues in BlackRock Solutions (BRS) and the Aladdin Product Group (APG) to continually enhance functionality by designing and implementing future technology roadmaps for the eFront product suite and BAI franchise. Additionally, we directly build augmented solutions to keep pace with the evolving investment landscape, such as environmental and social impact. Lastly, of great importance to private markets, we leverage artificial intelligence technologies, including natural language processing and machine learning, to turn unstructured data into meaningful insights.



BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

About this role
Senior Software Engineer – Java – VP
Data Operations Engineering (DOE)
Data is at the heart of Aladdin and, increasingly, the ability to consume, store, analyze, and gain insight from data has become a key component of what differentiates us. The Data Operations Engineering (DOE) team is responsible for the data ecosystem within BlackRock. Our goal is to build and maintain an innovative data platform that provides highly available, consistent data of the highest quality for all users of the platform, notably investors, operations teams, and data scientists. We focus on evolving our platform to deliver exponential scale to the firm, powering the future growth of Aladdin.

About this role
Are you interested in building innovative technology that shapes the financial markets? Do you like working at the speed of a startup, but want to solve some of the world’s most complex problems? Do you want to work with, and learn from, hands-on leaders in technology and finance?
At BlackRock, we are looking for Software Engineers who like to innovate and solve complex problems. We recognize that strength comes from diversity, and will embrace your unique skills, curiosity, drive, and passion while giving you the opportunity to grow technically and as an individual.
With over USD $7 trillion of assets we have an exceptional responsibility: our technology empowers millions of investors to save for retirement, pay for college, buy a home and improve their financial wellbeing.

Title: Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure
Job_Description:
Company Overview
At Transform, we are building a metrics repository that enables businesses to capture metric definitions in a standardized, well-formatted, and organized way to streamline analysis and enable decision-making with confidence and speed. We bridge the gap between those who know the data and those who need the data by creating a trusted metrics repository with an accessible user interface and a broad set of connectors to seamlessly pipe data to downstream systems.
We are backed by Index, Redpoint, Fathom, and Work Life Ventures and have years of experience working on data at Airbnb, Facebook, Slack, BlackRock, and Instagram. We’ve dedicated our careers to improving data infrastructure, from warehouses to machine learning platforms. We saw at Airbnb that a metrics repository improves both the speed and trustworthiness of data across all tools at a company.

Description
About this role
Technology & Operations
Technology & Operations is the backbone for both the client lifecycle and the investment lifecycle. The group’s Follow the Sun Model ensures that the firm’s operations are consistent and efficient across all investment products, client channels and regions, helping to deliver a superior client experience and drive scalability. Technology & Operations is driven by a global network of Operating Centers of Excellence, which centralizes knowledge and equips support teams with the data and timely information needed to innovate and deliver on behalf of internal partners and clients.
BlackRock’s Technology & Enterprise Service Group aims to provide BlackRock Employees with robust technology infrastructure and strategic workplace solutions to deliver a consistent employee experience around the world, while handling information security and data integrity. Teams aligned to support the firm’s functions.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst
Job_Description:
BlackRock Resources is seeking highly qualified candidates for a Business Analyst opportunity with our pipeline client in Houston, TX.

Core Functions:
Oversees, plans and coordinates analysis of highly complex business processes and executive information needs to enable the business to function more effectively
Act as a highly specialized advanced individual contributor in analyzing highly complex business processes and opportunities
Supervises projects and/or analysts in execution of system changes or enhancements
Makes decisions and recommendations having both short- and long-term impact on the business or department
Exercises independent judgment in selection and understanding information, handling analytical problems for non-routine issues; ability to quickly determine when deviations or anomalies can lead to problems

Title: Sr. Business Analyst
Job_Description:
Description
About this role
About this role
Introduction to Securities Lending
The Global Securities Lending business is part of BlackRock’s Global Lending and Liquidity group, which also includes the Cash Management team. Global Lending and Liquidity is part of BlackRock’s Portfolio Management Group (PMG). Along with other Investment teams, Global Securities Lending helps our clients solve their investment challenges and strives to deliver persistent, long-term investment performance. Our investment professionals manage over $300 billion in loans and benefit from the resources of a world-class technology firm that is differentiated by a team approach, integrated research, and risk management. Everyone at BlackRock has a role to play in leading the firm’s future growth. We believe that diverse teams with complementary strengths are critical to our success.
#EarlyCareers
For New York City only: The salary range for this position is $95,000 - $110,000. Additionally, employees are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, and benefits including heath care, leave benefits, and retirement benefits. BlackRock operates a pay-for-performance compensation philosophy and your total compensation may vary based on role, location, and firm, department and individual performance.
